■ Project Re:Kuroi Start Phase
As \N[4]`s plan successfully cleared the
third district and old magic school`s
basement of monsters, we will move to
the research phase of analyzing the
Black Pearl and its influence. Though
\N[5]`s memories have already been
wiped, we will hold until the next
research phase.

■ Monster Transformation
We hypothesize that, just as \N[4]
predicted, monster transformation is
caused by Black-type magic.
Ways to revert them to their original
is difficult, as it depends on the
monster. However, since most were
transformed by the Black Pearl, we will
prioritize its research.

■ The Night of Black Snow
Though the black snow on this night was
formed from fragments of the Black Pearl
mixing in with the natural snow, it has
been proven that the Black Pearl itself
has no influence on flora or fauna. We
will continue researching the monsters
in the northern snowfields under the
hypothesis that their transformation
was due to their will and desires.

■ Memories of \N[5]
After gradually erasing her memories of
\N[5], we saw an improvement in \N[14]`s
condition. We will project the erased
memories into \N[5] and confirm their
influence. \N[7] will conduct the
projection.

■ Memory Projection into \N[5]
When \N[5] regained memories of \N[5],
her condition worsened. We will erase
\N[5]`s memories once again and continue
to observe the condition of both.

■ Memory Preservation and Transformation
We conclude that it will be difficult to
preserve memories of \N[5] and 
\N[14]`s condition.

■ Moving Forward
After dealing with all memories relating
to \N[5], \N[14] was fully healed. 
We will now once again project memories
into \N[5] and explain the process of
Re:Kuroi to him. We will not allow
anyone involved outside contact until we
gain \N[5]`s consent.

■ The End of Project Re:Kuroi
With \N[5]`s consent, we erased all
memories of him. Next, we will analyze
\N[5] and confirm the level of
influence. \N[1] will accompany him,
and \N[4] and \N[7] will continue
to observe the process.
